item.title: The Lucky Charm of Wylie ISD: Me!
item.dc:creator: local
item.description: Greetings, citizens of Wylie, As your illustrious Superintendent, I find myself in a reflective mood today, which I assure you is not solely due to the brilliant shine off my pristine, bald pate. No, dear readers, I am moved to reflect on the towering bastion of success that is Wylie Independent School District, and more […]
item.content:encoded:
Greetings, citizens of Wylie,

As your illustrious Superintendent, I find myself in a reflective mood today, which I assure you is not solely due to the brilliant shine off my pristine, bald pate. No, dear readers, I am moved to reflect on the towering bastion of success that is Wylie Independent School District, and more precisely, how your lives have been forever blessed by my leadership.

I’ve been told humility is a virtue. Indeed, if I possessed such a quality, I’d be quite humble about the magnanimity of my influence. But alas, your dear Superintendent David Vinson was not made for modesty. You see, like the bright chrome dome I proudly polish each morning, my achievements gleam in the bright light of day, visible for all to admire.
